page.title: 02St Mary's Church,Redlynch
page.content: St Mary's Church was built in 1837 because people had to walk a long way to Downton church.The wife of the then vicar of Downton gave a clock to the church and 16 pounds a year so that the children of Redlynch could have a teacher. The family from Newhouse and the family from Hamptworth Lodge each have a pew at the front of the church.In the past they gave things to the church including the stained glass windows and the organ. In the graveyard are stone ,wood and iron graves.The iron ones were made in the village.One grave is decorated with pretty coloured tiles.It is for Harriet Whitmarsh who died in 1876 when she was a young teacher at our school.
